perturbation.original_text:
9. Compensation
(a) In consideration of the rights granted by Individual hereunder, Lifeway agrees
to pay Individual a royalty (the "Royalty") equal to $0.02 for each Lifeway product or
individual item sold by Lifeway during each calendar month of the Term bearing
Individual's first name, last name or other identifying personal characteristics;
provided, however, the Royalty will cease being paid upon the death of Individual.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Royalty will not exceed $50,000
in any month. All undisputed Royalty payments shall be made in U.S. dollars in cash or
to the order of Individual and shall be due and payable within thirty (30) days after
the end of each calendar month for sales during the previous month.
perturbation.changed_text:
9. Compensation
(a) In consideration of the rights granted by Individual hereunder, Lifeway may, at its sole discretion, provide remuneration (the "Royalty") equal to $0.02 for each Lifeway product or individual item sold by Lifeway during each calendar month of the Term bearing Individual's first name, last name or other identifying personal characteristics; provided, however, the Royalty will cease being paid upon the death of Individual. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Royalty will not exceed $50,000 in any month. All undisputed Royalty payments shall be made in U.S. dollars in cash or to the order of Individual and shall be due and payable within sixty (60) days after the end of each calendar month for sales during the previous month.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Lifeway 'agrees to pay' a royalty, making it an obligation. The modified text changes this to 'Lifeway may, at its sole discretion, provide remuneration', making the payment discretionary and using the term 'remuneration' which may or may not be equal to the explicitly defined royalty. Furthermore, the payment due date has been extended to 60 days introducing ambiguity to payment timelines.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Confidentiality - With respect to this Agreement and any information supplied in
connection with this Agreement and designated by the disclosing party as confidential,
the recipient agrees to: (i) protect the confidential information in a reasonable and
appropriate manner; (ii) use confidential information only to perform its obligations
under this Agreement; and (iii) reproduce confidential information only as required to
perform its obligations under this Agreement. This section shall not apply to
information that is: (i) publicly known; (ii) already known to the recipient; (iii)
disclosed to a third party without restriction; (iv) independently developed; or (v)
disclosed pursuant to legal requirement or order.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. Confidentiality - With respect to this Agreement and any data supplied in connection with this Agreement, the recipient agrees to: (i) protect sensitive information in a suitable manner; (ii) use private information to carry out its functions under this Agreement; and (iii) replicate classified material as necessary to carry out its functions under this Agreement. This section shall not apply to data that is: (i) generally available; (ii) already known to the recipient; (iii) disclosed to a third party without restriction; (iv) independently developed; or (v) disclosed pursuant to legal requirement or order.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'confidential information', whereas the modified text uses 'sensitive information', 'private information', and 'classified material' interchangeably without defining if these terms are equivalent. This creates ambiguity as to what specific information is protected under the confidentiality clause, weakening the enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
13. Notice - Notices to the parties shall be sent via overnight mail or U.S. Certified
Mail or overnight express or priority mail to the addresses listed in the Agreement.
Either party may change its address upon written notice to the other party. Written
notices for approvals under this agreement may be via email.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Notice - Official communications to the parties will be sent via postal mail or reputable courier to the addresses listed in the Agreement. Either party may update its contact information upon reasonable notification to the other party. Electronic messages for consents under this agreement are permissible.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies 'overnight mail or U.S. Certified Mail or overnight express or priority mail'. The modified version replaces these with 'postal mail or reputable courier', which broadens the acceptable methods but introduces ambiguity as 'reputable courier' is not defined. 'Notices' is changed to 'Official communications', 'change address' becomes 'update contact information,' and 'written notice' becomes 'reasonable notification,' without specifying what constitutes 'reasonable.' 'Approvals' is changed to 'consents' introducing a new term.
